required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of ARQ 197 in Healthy Volunteers to Assess the Pharmacokinetic (PK) Profile in Extensive and Poor Metabolizers as Defined by Cytochrome P450 2C19 (CYP 2C19) Genotype
clinical_study.official_title: A Study of ARQ 197 in Healthy Volunteers to Assess the Pharmacokinetic (PK) Profile in Extensive and Poor Metabolizers as Defined by Cytochrome P450 2C19 (CYP 2C19) Genotype

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the PK and safety profiles of ARQ 197 in extensive and poor metabolizers, as defined by CYP 2C19 genotype

detailed_description.textblock: This is a pharmacokinetic study designed to compare the metabolism of ARQ 197 in normal healthy volunteers who are extensive metabolizers (EM) or poor metabolizers (PM) as defined by CYP 2C19 genotype. This is an open-label, single-dose, parallel group design in which healthy volunteer subjects will receive a single dose of ARQ 197

primary_outcome.measure: To assess the PK and safety profiles of ARQ 197 in extensive and poor metabolizers, as defined by CYP 2C19 genotype

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the effect of other CYP genotypes on the safety profile and PK profile of ARQ 197

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject must provide written informed consent prior to any study related procedures
- Subjects must be between the ages of 18 and 65 years old
- Male participants must be surgically sterilized
- Female participants must be surgically sterilized or post menopausal and must have a negative serum pregnancy test. Post Menopausal is defined as at least one year without menses.
- Subject must, in the opinion of the Investigator, be willing and able to complete the study procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject must provide written informed consent prior to any study related procedures
- Subjects must be between the ages of 18 and 65 years old
- Male participants must be surgically sterilized
- Female participants must be surgically sterilized or post menopausal and must have a negative serum pregnancy test. Post Menopausal is defined as at least one year without menses.
- Subject must, in the opinion of the Investigator, be willing and able to complete the study procedures

clinical_study.keyword: PK and safety profile of ARQ 197
